results.content:
The instructor mentions that he's assuming you already have some experience with HTML and JS coding. However, he also provides resources and assistance to those that may need further help to understand.
That said, I think this is a perfect course to walk you through the basics of a simple game and pick up the 'language' by immersion.
results.content_html:
The instructor mentions that he's assuming you already have some experience with HTML and JS coding. However, he also provides resources and assistance to those that may need further help to understand.
That said, I think this is a perfect course to walk you through the basics of a simple game and pick up the 'language' by immersion.

results.content: This course is okay for those who are looking to do something in JavaScript. By no means is this a learn JS course, so look elsewhere if you where thinking that. Otherwise, I did enjoy the course, to me it was just something to do because I am new to JS and wanted to do something visual with the language. The instructor is kind of hard to understand, but nothing too troubling. I like that it's short and to the point.
results.content_html: This course is okay for those who are looking to do something in JavaScript. By no means is this a learn JS course, so look elsewhere if you where thinking that. The instructor is kind of hard to understand, but nothing too troubling. I like that it's short and to the point.

results.content:
Hi my name is Erik Petersson and I'm a .net developer aiming to create a solid foundation for my company Shackle. I'm very interrested in game development but I'm still very novice. This course has helped me understand JavaScript game development further. In my opinion the instructor manages to supply a course with approx 2,5h of video material that is outstanding when comparing what you can learn from the 2,5h of videos. This course was extremly fun to go through, but of course after all that knowledge gained per video I had to take a few breaks. 

I made an honest review about this specific course:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pN6xtzSekbA

// Erik Petersson, Shackle
results.content_html:

// Erik Petersson, Shackle

results.content:
The course is good, for people who're planning to buy it.
The thing which isn't that good is that you have to be intermediate to advanced in Javascript to fully understand every concept in this course.
I rate myself 3/10 in javascript, knowing only the basics, but that's totally not enough to fully understand this course and do it multiple times. But I had fun imitating the course maker's coding and successfully did the game, which was interesting.

Positives: Short course, into the work, and all questions you have are already answered by the instructor in the Q&A section.
Negatives: For intermediates in JS, and no source code between lectures.

I'd recommend this course for anybody who has a very good basic knowledge in Javascript. 
That's it! Goodluck!
results.content_html:
The course is good, for people who're planning to buy it.
The thing which isn't that good is that you have to be intermediate to advanced in Javascript to fully understand every concept in this course.
I rate myself 3/10 in javascript, knowing only the basics, but that's totally not enough to fully understand this course and do it multiple times. But I had fun imitating the course maker's coding and successfully did the game, which was interesting.

Positives: Short course, into the work, and all questions you have are already answered by the instructor in the Q&A section.
Negatives: For intermediates in JS, and no source code between lectures.

I'd recommend this course for anybody who has a very good basic knowledge in Javascript.
That's it! Goodluck!

results.content:
Decent course and easy enough to follow the instructor. Several times he actually leaves out pieces of code that draw in parts of the game, he does add notes telling you but seems like a silly thing to miss. Also the game is too simple and definitely not finished, it's the same thing every time with almost no change (hardly a game). There should be a section that adds code to change the direction of the ball based on what part of the paddle it hits instead of it always being the exact same thing every time. 

tldr: Instructor is easy to comprehend but misses some code and the game is incomplete.
results.content_html:
Decent course and easy enough to follow the instructor. Several times he actually leaves out pieces of code that draw in parts of the game, he does add notes telling you but seems like a silly thing to miss. Also the game is too simple and definitely not finished, it's the same thing every time with almost no change (hardly a game). There should be a section that adds code to change the direction of the ball based on what part of the paddle it hits instead of it always being the exact same thing every time.

tldr: Instructor is easy to comprehend but misses some code and the game is incomplete.

results.content: The course is well structured and each step is well explained. Currently the course aims to explain the basic principles of game mechanics and code structure. The resulting game works nicely and I had fun making it.

results.content: The course explains everything efficiently, but the instructor talks a bit too fast. I learned many tips to fix mistakes and typos, and it was really fun to create a simple  game in less than 1.5 hours!

results.content: This course is the best explanation on how to use JS I've seen. Although there is much more to JS than was covered here, it is a nice course to put together the working knowledge of JS after watching other verbose and technical courses. This course also expands the world of JS by looking at animation, event handlers, and drawing with explicit and logical explainations. Great Job!
results.content_html: This course is the best explanation on how to use JS I've seen. Although there is much more to JS than was covered here, it is a nice course to put together the working knowledge of JS after watching other verbose and technical courses. This course also expands the world of JS by looking at animation, event handlers, and drawing with explicit and logical explainations. Great Job!

results.content:
The subject is interesting
The instructor has many typos and does not build the code in a structured manner.
For example the initialization of the brick's locations should be performed once in the program and not in every frame.
The location of the functions and event handling methods in the code are scattered with no structural sense.
Using a non paid version of sublime text and ignoring the payment messages does not pass well. Buy the software or don't use it in a tutorial.
results.content_html:
The subject is interesting
The instructor has many typos and does not build the code in a structured manner.
For example the initialization of the brick's locations should be performed once in the program and not in every frame.
The location of the functions and event handling methods in the code are scattered with no structural sense.
Using a non paid version of sublime text and ignoring the payment messages does not pass well. Buy the software or don't use it in a tutorial.
